column2: As their enchanted arrows are both light and strong this unit can fire two at a time, but at the cost of range.
Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]Leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.
This unit can move whilst hidden in any terrain, firing in any direction even whilst running!
This unit's melee attacks can stay the hand of those on the receiving end.
A rigorous selection process and relentless training have turned this unit into the perfect fighting machine. This effect is lost, however, if the unit is badly damaged.
Scaly skin or hides help to dampen or deflect the damage caused by missile weapons, increasing this unit's [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_missile.png]][[/img]]Missile Resistance.
When under pressure, the primal instincts of these natural predators take over. They then may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.
When death is imminent, this unit has a chance of regaining some of its health.
The [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/wh_dlc06_unit_contact_sundered_armour.png]][[/img]]armour-splitting attacks of this unit can significantly weaken the target's armour.
Those who bear the Creator’s mark are afforded his divine vengeance; when struck down, their unworthy killer is soon engulfed by Asuryan’s vengeful flames!
When standing and bracing against a charge of large enemies (such as cavalry or monsters) this unit will negate the enemy's [[img:icon_charge]][[/img]]charge bonus.
When standing and bracing against a charge this unit will negate the enemy's [[img:icon_charge]][[/img]]charge bonus.
This unit is quicker than most when it comes to smashing through gates with their melee weapons.
The scaled leather of the flightless Sea Dragon provides a very light yet incredibly sturdy material for armour.
Whereas some units struggle to fight and move in shallow water, aquatic units excel.
Elite unit with stats greatly improved over those of its standard counterpart.
When this unit gets hurt and enemies are nearby it might go on a rampage, attacking the closest enemy and ignoring any orders given.
The Witch Elves' venom makes its target susceptible to the Madness of Khaine – forcing it into a mindless, rampaging bloodlust.
Loosing arrows of mystical blue fire, they excel at setting vulnerable units ablaze and piercing the toughest armour.

Misleadingly, and to the horror of anyone exposed to its content, the globes thrown by the Poison Wind Globadiers do not release poison, but a small cloud of lethal Warpstone gas. The larger the target's surface, the more pain it will experience.
When a bomb is smashed, a dark smoke curls out, concealing those who wish to hide and choking everyone else.
This unit has magical attacks and becomes stronger when the winds of magic are in full gale.
Masters of stealth, concealment, and the precision shot, this unit stays hidden while firing.
The eldest, most powerful Dragons can melt armour and the flesh beneath with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.
After a Moon Dragon’s fiery breath engulfs its victim, scorched armour is often all that remains.

A particularly stupid and otherwise useless Goblin prisoner is tied to a boulder and is then fired - screaming all the way - until he smashes into the target. Those hit by this projectile receive a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership penalty.
Some ranged weapons, like grenade launchers, bombs or blasting charges, can't target airborne units.

The damage of [[img:icon_ap]][[/img]]armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the armour of the target, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They are often heavier and attack at a slower rate though, making them less efficient against poorly-armoured targets.
While airborne, this unit can use a special attack to damage enemies below.
Uses Dark Magic to damage nearby enemy units over time.
The Sun Dragon's scorching breath lacks focus, but hitting a larger area is actually an advantage when fighting infantry groups.
The servants and worshippers of Loec perform many intricate, swirling, lethal dances in his name.
The intense cold cuts into the flesh and burns the foe's extremities, greatly reducing their speed.
Like a rain of mighty hammer-blows from above, this unit drops more than one bomb at the same time.

This unit is best used to attack individual targets such as [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lords or [[img:icon_hero]][[/img]]Heroes. As it can only damage very few individuals at a time, it is not suitable against hordes of weak enemies.
Merciless, frenzied agents of slaughter even when unprovoked, this unit takes especially well to Khaine’s murderous blessing.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain and is exceptionally hard to target with missile attacks.
This unit has a very low rate of missile fire.
The Black Coach feeds on magical energy that bolsters its resistance and strengthens its charge.
Improves [[img:icon_melee_attack]][[/img]]melee attack and [[img:icon_ap]][[/img]]armour-piercing potential of nearby friendly units.
Increases the chance of enemy Wizards miscasting in close vicinity to a Corpse Cart.
This unit's attack can hardly punch through armour and is thus wasted on heavily armoured enemies.
The colourful tattoos on their bare skin grant Savage Orcs [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_physical.png]][[/img]]Physical Resistance, which reduces the damage from any non-magical attack.
These units are natural hunters that can sense prey hiding nearby.
Wielding an ‘eavy choppa in each hand, the Krimson Killerz cleave through several foes with each swing.

The Hellcannon transforms the souls of former victims into crackling bolts of energy. Targets hit by this projectile receive a [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership penalty. The daemonic bond between the Hellcannon and its shot also allows minor corrections of the latter's flightpath. When fired in first-person mode, you can control the projectile yourself.
While Dwarfs are generally not the most nimble inhabitants of the Old World, they can move surprisingly fast when not slowed by heavy armour.
This unit can run circles around most other units, taunting and harassing the enemy or evading its missile fire.
After being showered in an unholy flood of odiferous flames, those left fleeing in panic are the lucky ones.
This unit can fire while on the move.
Large units do not suffer penalties when moving through forest, simply smashing through the undergrowth instead.
Short-range throwing attack that slows the target.
This elite unit excels at pinning the enemy down in melee, buying time for the rest of your army to get into position.
White Lion fur is not merely a fashionable status symbol, it also provides protection against regular and magical missile attacks.
Imbued with the foulest proclamations of hate, these ethereal projectiles can tear through entire enemy columns.
This unit improves all nearby friendly missile units.
The projectile fired by this unit can home in on its target. When fired in first-person mode, you can control the projectile yourself.
Armoured units can block damage from any source apart from [[img:icon_ap]][[/img]]Armour-Piercing damage.
Ethereal units ignore most damage done by non-magical weapons. As they have shed most of their physical form, they are not slowed by terrain-based movement penalties either.
This unit has a larger [[img:icon_range]][[/img]]range than most other units of the same class. This allows it to take out hostile missile units before they can come into firing range.
Increases the level of magic [[img:icon_wom_power]][[/img]]power reserves.
[[img:icon_shield]][[/img]]Shields have a chance of blocking arrows, bolts, rifle shots and similar small arms fire - but only in a forward facing arc.
This icy blast freezes and slows the foe, its withering cold hampering their attacks.

Slayers are unbreakable and always fight to the bitter end – sometimes even beyond that! Imminent death only makes them fight harder. When killed in melee, Slayers launch a final attack with their dying breaths.

This unit can switch its ammunition to fire multiple smaller shots instead of one large one. This is not as accurate or effective against large targets, but the spread of missiles can be helpful against hordes.

Anti-large units have an advantage against targets that are at least as large as a horse. This advantage can be a [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_bonus_vs_large.png]][[/img]]damage bonus against large targets or an attack that focuses on a very small area. However, some units are simply better against large targets because their attacks are slow and easy to dodge by skilled melee combatants.
This unit has a special missile attack with limited [[img:icon_ammo]][[/img]]ammunition, which can be very useful when initiating attacks.
Just give the order and the Hydra's heads will spew forth their fiery breath, each competing for the brightest flame.
This highly dexterous unit dodges blades and missiles with ease; its luck is known to run out quickly when facing magical weapons, however.
Warpstone dust and vile contagions fill this diabolical censer, exposure to which does horrendous things to bodies and minds alike.
This unit has a strong emphasis on dealing damage. If fighting it, make sure to take it out before it can get into firing or melee range.

Armoured units can block damage from any source apart from [[img:icon_ap]][[/img]]Armour-Piercing damage. [[img:icon_shield]][[/img]]Shields have a chance of blocking arrows, bolts, rifle shots and similar small arms fire - but only in a forward facing arc.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
This unit is surrounded by one or more magical auras that either support nearby friends or harm its foes.

[[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/wh_main_unit_passive_regeneration.png]][[/img]]Regeneration allows a unit to heal while in battle. Fire is known to harm this healing process, so be warned that [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_flaming.png]][[/img]]flaming attacks will cause more damage to units with Regeneration.
As if smote by mighty Gork himself, this unit’s projectile blinds its target on impact, reducing accuracy, melee attack and melee defence capabilities

Melee Experts might have a very strong [[img:icon_melee_attack]][[/img]]melee attack or [[img:icon_melee_defence]][[/img]]melee defence, or high values in both. Some also have melee-focused skills like [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/charge_reflector.png]][[/img]]Charge Defence. Use them to counter other strong melee units. When facing them, it is best to take them out before they can enter melee.
Knights who have sipped from the Grail are elevated above mere mortals; they truly are what is best in men.

Invented by Clan Skryre, these globes release a magical gas that is more stable than the Warpstone gas used in Poison Wind Globes. Hanging in the air longer and thus spreading further, it is especially lethal against large groups of targets.
Some Dragons breathe noxious fumes that have a long-lasting effect on their target's coordination - if it survived the attack in the first place.
Instead of salvoes of cannonballs, the infamous 'Gallows Giant' covers its enemies in a wave of incinerating fire.
The heaviest, strongest and meanest of Orcs, Big 'Uns are eager to prove it against enemies of all sizes.
The Luminark fires a highly-accurate beam over large distances, causing tremendous damage to its target but with a small area of effect, making it a poor choice against weak infantry.
The Keeper of the Casket may allow some of the tormented spirits trapped inside to escape; not for mercy, but to let the damned souls rain down upon a loosely-specified area.
This unit can bind magic into powerful runes which can be activated during battle.
Slayers are armed with two axes, deftly whirling them at high speed to deflect incoming missile fire.
Fire attacks cannot harm the wearer of this enchanted, volcano-forged armour.
This unit's attacks are prone to go stray.
This unit’s [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_armour_break.png]][[/img]] shield-breaking attacks can significantly weaken the target’s chance of blocking missile attacks.

Anti-infantry units have an advantage against targets that are smaller than a horse. This advantage can be a [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_bonus_vs_infantry.png]][[/img]]damage bonus against small targets, superior weight used to smash through lighter enemies, or an explosive attack from range that effects a large area.

[[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/resistance_physical.png]][[/img]]Physical Resistance will reduce the damage from any attack that is not [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_magical.png]][[/img]]magical.
The spirits of Athel Loren are able to shrug off most mundane attacks, causing magical damage in turn before melting into the forest from whence they came.
The crystal protects those who worship the Serpent God, healing wounds and bringing supplicants back from the point of death.
An intense, white-hot shaft of light emanates forth, burning and blinding the foe with the wrath of Chotec himself.
The dark flames of Chaos burn flesh, armour and souls alike; the Ruinous Powers do not discriminate.
The Elves of Athel Loren gain bonuses to melee defence and accuracy while fighting within the forest.
Specialists in forest warfare, this unit gains melee attack and defence advantages when fighting in forests.
The art of deflecting arrows with a greatsword is painful to learn; such training is discouraged by Bladelord officers, but no true Swordmaster will let caution best his pride.

The damage of [[img:icon_ap]][[/img]]armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the armour of the target, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They are often heavier and attack at a slower rate though, making them less efficient against poorly-armoured targets.

The damage of [[img:icon_ap]][[/img]]armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the armour of the target, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They are often heavier and attack at a slower rate though, making them less efficient against poorly-armoured targets.

Respected for their great age, superior courage and the length of their facial hair, Longbeards have an encouraging effect on their allies' [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership should the [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord be absent.
This unit can learn prayers to support allies and defeat foes in battle.
Despite being primarily a missile unit or spellcaster, this unit can also hold its own ground when fighting in melee.
When death is imminent, this unit has a chance of either regaining some of its health or releasing a pack of ravening Skaven instead.
While unimpressive at causing damage, this unit is useful as a 'meat shield', absorbing damage that would otherwise hurt a more useful or precious target.
Morghur's Ruinous, transformative aura protects him from damage most of the time, but he is vulnerable whilst it recharges.
Weeping Blades devour armour. A couple of slashes is all that's needed for their corrosive venom to eat through even the thickest of plates.
Even when performing the most fatiguing acts, this unit never loses vigour.
This unit can deploy in an expanded deployment area, allowing it to start the battle within striking distance of the enemy - or somewhere unexpected.
This unit does not suffer any form of [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership loss and will never rout.
Warpstone dust and vile contagions are amongst the ingredients of this catapult’s liquid missiles, exposure to which does horrendous things to bodies and minds alike.
These enchanted bows, only entrusted to those of noble birth, fire three arrows at once.
This unit suffers from poor [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership and will easily rout. Keep its flanks secure and your [[img:icon_general]][[/img]]Lord or other encouraging units nearby.
Doors and gates all across the world fear the Khainite Assassin's assortment of lock picks and acid vials.
The [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/wh_main_unit_contact_poison.png]][[/img]]poisonous attacks of this unit weaken the target's speed and damage.
Units with [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/wh_main_unit_passive_frenzy.png]][[/img]]frenzy cause more damage while their [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]leadership is high.
Units possessed of primal fury move faster and charge harder, causing more damage when they connect with their targets.
The Doomwheel sports fully automatic Warp-lightning rods which discharge bolts in front, and to the left and right.
The crystal protects those who worship the Serpent God, healing wounds and bringing supplicants back from the point of death.

This unit can [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/causes_terror.png]][[/img]]cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and [[img:ui/battle ui/ability_icons/causes_fear.png]][[/img]]fear themselves.
This unit can attack walls, towers and gates.
